alert.note: Alert for Southeastern Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 02 at 8:28PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast and northwest Nevada, including the following areas, in northeast Nevada, Southeastern Elko County. In northwest Nevada, Humboldt County. * WHEN...Through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - - A slow moving upper level trough combined with ample tropical/monsoonal moisture to generate multiple rounds of widespread showers and thunderstorms, with the strongest cells producing up to 1 inch of rainfall. Excessive rainfall from these storms could lead to localized flash flooding during the Labor Day holiday weekend lasting through Monday afternoon with storm total rainfall of 0.5" to 3" possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
